reviewText: The third in the "mondo" series by Jacopetti and Prosperi once again sees the pair traveling the word looking for the bizarre. This time out the material is less shocking and unfortunately also a lot less interesting on the whole.Part of the problem here is that the directors tried to add to many examples resulting in an incomplete mess. What had once been interesting and unique had now become fodder for the popcorn crowd. In a few years the outrage would be replaced with such fare as Faces of Death.See it if you are a Mondo completist otherwise its just not that special.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Somethings in this movie will still amaze you "The Cargo Gods" The Morons dragging thier tongues bloody up the church steps ( I could go on & on) but you will have to deceide. Good luck the freak show continues.
summary: As relevant today as the day it was made..

reviewText: Finally restored,  Mondo Cane 2 is both grotesque and hilarious.  There are the usual mondo staples that were considered very shocking in the 60's such as the mandatory lesbian club scene,  that are very cornball now,  but so what.  Not as gory as some other classic mondos--such as Macabro (aka Tabu 2).  Too bad the mondo genre was effectively destroyed by the ridiculous Faces of Death series.  The most recently well made mondo that comes to mind is "RITUALS:  Dances Sacred and Profane"---and that was a long time ago.  Not for everyone,  but MC 2 is a popcorn treat for those with a taste for the bizarre.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I got this based on the first Mondo Cane...this one failed to measure up even the least.  It was not a good buy.
summary: not as good as the first
